clauses.title: Your identity is used in ads that are shown to other users
clauses.description:
Ads shown to other users may include a reference to you as an implied endorsement.
Might give away information about your own personal lifestyle to strangers.
clauses.clause_text: You give us permission to use your profile name, profile photo, and information about your activities and actions you have taken, including your use of third party products, services, or devices, in ads, offers and other commercial contexts on the Strava service without compensation to you.

case.text: Your identity is used in ads that are shown to other users

clauses.title: This service may collect, use, and share location data
clauses.description: Location-based information is collected and may be used and/or shared with third parties for purposes not directly related to the services provided (i.e. the Service doesn't rely on the use or share of location data to function properly).
clauses.clause_text: Your precise location information, such as where you run or ride, may also be shared on Strava or to non-members, in accordance with your privacy controls.

case.text: This service may collect, use, and share location data

clauses.title: Tracking via third-party cookies for advertising
clauses.description: The service's website sets third-party cookies (cookies that do not belong to their domain) for purposes not including statistics and analytics.
clauses.clause_text: Some of these cookies are advertising cookies, which we employ to serve relevant ads to users who have already visited our website. We use the following cookies for advertising purposes: Google AdWords and Branch.

case.text: Third-party cookies are used for advertising

clauses.title: This service can share your personal information to third parties
clauses.description: Your personal data is or may be given to third parties nonessential to the service’s operation. This could be a business partner that receives your data to provide targeted advertisements.
clauses.clause_text: Strava may share personal data with third parties "including" (and therefore not limited) with law enforcement, if the disclosure is "allowed by the law".

case.text: This service shares your personal data with third parties that are not essential to its operation

clauses.title: Users have a reduced time period to take legal action against the service
clauses.description: If you wish to bring legal action against a service about a past incident, you may not be able to do so if the Terms you agreed to implied a limited amount of time. As a result it may be worthy to carefully read that section of the Terms to know exactly how much time you might have before your right to take legal action expires.
clauses.clause_text: Except to the extent prohibited by applicable law, the parties agree that any claim or cause of action arising out of or related to use of the Services or the Terms must be filed within one (1) year after such claim or cause of action arose or be forever barred.

case.text: You have a reduced time period to take legal action against the service

clauses.title: This service tracks which web page referred you to it
clauses.description: The service logs the URL of the last web page you visited before visiting the Site and may use that information to gather more data about you.
clauses.clause_text: "The information stored in those files includes IP addresses, browser type, internet service provider (ISP), referring/exit pages, platform type, date/time stamp, and number of clicks. "

case.text: This service tracks which web page referred you to it

clauses.title: The service can sell or otherwise transfer your personal data as part of a bankruptcy proceeding or other type of financial transaction.
clauses.description: If the service gets acquired or is involved in a merger, bankruptcy, reorganisation or sale, your personal data may be transferred or sold.
clauses.clause_text: If Strava becomes involved in a business combination, securities offering, bankruptcy, reorganization, dissolution or other similar transaction, we may share or transfer your information in connection with such transaction.

case.text: Your personal data may be sold or otherwise transferred as part of a bankruptcy proceeding or other type of financial transaction

clauses.title: You waive your right to a class action.
clauses.description: The right to be represented in a class action (or representative action) exists in the US and some European countries. It allows people who have been similarly injured by the same accused to take legal action by a single lawsuit instead of individually. Some Terms of Service try to limit that right. By agreeing to them, you could waive (= renounce to) your right to a class action, which might reduce your chances to be successful in a case.
clauses.clause_text:
Class-Action Waiver

The parties further agree that any arbitration shall be conducted in their individual capacities only, and not as a class action or other representative action.

case.text: You waive your right to a class action.

clauses.title: This service forces users into binding arbitration in the case of disputes for users outside the EU
clauses.description: This service forces users to use their own contracted arbitrator and forces users to waive their rights to jury trial.
clauses.clause_text: Except for disputes relating to the Strava’s intellectual property (such as trademarks, trade dress, domain names, trade secrets, copyrights, and patents) or if you opt out of this agreement to arbitrate, all claims arising out of or relating to this Agreement and your use of the Services shall be finally settled by binding arbitration administered by JAMS in accordance with its provisions and procedures for consumer-related disputes, excluding any rules or procedures governing or permitting class actions.

case.text: You are forced into binding arbitration in case of disputes

Record your activities and analyze your performance. For example, to compare your past efforts, analyze your training, and (with your consent) use your heart rate information to provide you with interesting and useful performance analysis.
